Merry-go-round is a registered charity and social enterprise supporting local families in three main ways:
A charity shop selling everything baby at low low prices
A partnership programme supplying 100+ agencies in glasgow with free essential children’s goods
Community space to bring families together and reduce isolation

Current initiatives include a tool library, repair café events, a wood reuse scheme, educational workshops and climate conversation sessions.

org.content: We are a start-up Social Enterprise Company who are passionate about bridging the sewing machine skills gap so that this valuable, life-long skill is not lost in our generation. We are passionate about our environment and believe that we can only affect environmental change by equipping people with the skills and knowledge to do this. Our beginner sewing sessions are a small step in the direction to learning how to up-cycle, re-purpose and repair clothes and textiles.

org.content: Our Social Enterprise recycles retired bedlinen into sustainable handmade bespoke Beach Clean Bags. We will reduce the amount of retired bedlinen going into landfill by bringing it into the circular economy and reusing it for environmental benefits. Retired bedlinen can be made into a range of products including our handmade Beach Clean Bags. We intend to create rural jobs for sewers who can fabricate useful items from retired bedlinen.

Our vision is to create an alternative to a disposable society by making repair education accessible to all, to build a stronger, waste-free community and support vulnerable people within our city.

org.title: ReConnect Glasgow
org.content: ReConnect Glasgow has a vision to support local residents in the East End of Glasgow, as well as embody a reuse culture that helps save the planet. We aim to make sure as many items of furniture as possible are saved from landfill and sell them on through our shop to the people who need it the most. Everything we sell is high quality at bargain prices.

org.title: Glasgow Boys Brigade (86th)
org.content: The 86th Glasgow Boys Brigade run a local toy reuse and recycling project in Glasgow.

org.title: Accessible Tennis
org.content: Accessible Tennis advocates sustainability by providing tennis coaching in different venues across Scotland for underrepresented groups and lobbying for a reuse tennis equipment scheme.

org.title: Acharacle Community Company
org.content: Acharacle Community Company runs a waste reduction and reuse project and is always on the lookout for good quality donations.

org.title: Alloa Community Enterprises
org.content: Alloa Community Enterprises is Clackmannanshire's largest reuse furniture and bric-a-brac outlet.

org.title: Angus Cycle Hub
org.content: Angus Cycle Hub is dedicated to supporting and developing cycling across Angus with a number of projects, including the repair and sale of reuse bikes.

org.title: Babes In The Wood
org.content: Babes In The Wood reuse items to reduce the environmental impact of landfill waste. Their community shop in Stirling offers the sale of high quality, safety checked children's goods at low prices for local families.

org.title: Barra and Vatersay Environmental Services Ltd
org.content: Barra & Vatersay Waste Management offer community recycling services to promote greater recycling opportunities for their islands' communities.

org.title: Belhelvie Community Trust
org.content: Belhelvie Community Trust is a Development Trust to support the community who have come together to explore how to do more community focussed environment projects.

org.title: Bethany Christian Trust
org.content: Bethany Christian Trust is an Edinburgh-based charity for homelessness that accepts donations of furniture, household and electrical goods through it's charity shops in and around Edinburgh.

org.title: Blythswood Care
org.content: Blythswood Care deliver reuse and recycling services across Scotland through their network of charity shops, committed to the environment, it is a Christian organisation primarily dedicated to providing humanitarian aid, disaster relief and social care projects to people who need it in Europe, Africa and Asia.

org.title: Carthannas Nis
org.content: Carthannas Nis is a community charity shop in the village of Cross on Lewis in the Western Isles accepting donations of clothes, furniture and household goods from around the island.

org.title: Castle Furniture Project
org.content: Castle Furniture Project takes donations of good quality furniture, household items, toys, electrical appliances, white goods from throughout Fife and sell them in their reuse stores in Cupar and Glenrothes.

org.title: CFINE
org.content:
Community Food initiatives North East (CFINE) is a successful charity and social enterprise providing a quality service to thousands of individuals in NE Scotland across food supply, fareshare, circular economy and employability projects.

They are working in collaboration with XS Resources CIC to collect unwanted but working IT and small electrical equipment. All donated equipment will get refurbished and resold. CFINE are able to accept donations of working IT Equipment and small appliances on Wednesday’s and Friday’s between 11 – 1pm.

org.title: Coll Recycling Group
org.content: Recycoll are an environmental group based on the Hebridean island of Coll and undertake a range of recycling, reuse, composting and environmental projects.

org.title: COPE Ltd
org.content: COPE Ltd is a successful social enterprise, based in Shetland, providing employment and skill development for adults with learning disabilities or autism spectrum disorders across reuse, garden, catering and soap-making projects.

org.title: Dundee Starter Packs SCIO
org.content: Starter Packs Dundee accept donations of various household essentials such as towels, bedding, pots and pans, cleaning products, toiletries and more. These are then made into starter packs for previously homeless individuals moving into their first permanent tenancy – giving them the basics needed for a decent standard of living.

org.title: Earthtime For All
org.content: Earthtime is an award-winning, Moray-based charity connecting children and young people with the natural environment and the circular economy using creative and woodland based activities to improve self-esteem, health and well-being.

org.title: Emmaus Glasgow
org.content: Emmaus Glasgow – the homeless charity that works. We believe that people who are homeless and socially excluded have something to offer. Their Glasgow-based charity shops provide low-cost, recycled second-hand furniture, white goods, bric-a-brac, clothing and more throughout the local community.

org.title: Falkirk Homeless Project
org.content: The Falkirk Homeless Project collects furniture and household goods, passing them on to homeless people who are taking up new tenancies but cant afford to furnish a home from scratch.

org.title: Falkland Centre for Stewardship
org.content: The Falkland Centre for Stewardship is about Realising the potential of people and place. They run a number of events throughout the year and we work with a range of partners, volunteers and Friends who are often as passionate about the stewardship of this place and the wider world in which we live as they are.

org.title: Forward Coupar Angus
org.content: Forward Coupar Angus is a Development Trust founded to improve the economic, environmental and social sustainability of the town of Coupar Angus and its immediate surrounding area. A town that strives to create opportunities for a better social and working environment, while at the same time aiming to fight climate change by reducing carbon dioxide emissions in the community.

org.title: Four Square
org.content: The Edinburgh Furniture Initiative is a reuse furniture project run by Foursquare; a charity that has been supporting thousands of homeless and other vulnerable people for more than 40 years.

org.title: Fresh Start (Scotland)
org.content: Fresh Start is an Edinburgh-based charity that helps people who have been homeless get established in their new home.  Through involving volunteers and organisations from a broad section of the community, Fresh Start delivers a range of services that provide essential household goods, practical and social support that helps people resettle successfully.

org.title: Furniture Plus Ltd
org.content: Furniture Plus is the largest furniture re-use, recycling and repair organisation in Fife. Our main aim is to combat poverty and social exclusion, especially homelessness, through our core business activity of re-using, recycling and repairing furniture and other household goods that may otherwise have gone to landfill, benefitting local communities, both socially and environmentally, whilst generating core income to sustain the project.

org.title: Furniture Recycling Project Angus
org.content: The Furniture Recycling Project Angus (FRPA) aims to relieve the poverty, need and distress of the inhabitants of Angus by promoting the re-use of furniture, household goods, domestic electrical appliances and other equipment. It provides services, training, support and development to individuals and communities to enable them to overcome disadvantage.

org.title: Gordon Rural Action
org.content: Gordon Rural Action is a charity that provides support on a range of social issues with the aim of improving the quality of life for individuals. They manage two reuse shops selling second-hand goods, including furniture, clothing and bric-a-brac, which are donated by the generous community.

org.title: Granton Hub
org.content: Granton:hub is a community hub in North Edinburgh where people can meet, participate, learn, create and enjoy a range of great activities. We offer a range of workshops and classes, including drawing, painting, printmaking and bookbinding; have a growing archive of materials and objects connected to the history of the local area; and are home to a community garden thats open for all to visit and enjoy.

org.title: Healthy n Happy Community Development Trust
org.content: Healthy n Happy Community Development Trust is an award winning charity and community owned organisation governed by local people, where all of our work is directed by local priorities for Cambuslang and Rutherglen. All of what we offer, including our successful Bike Town Project supports and enables people to make positive changes in their lives and their community.

org.title: Hebrides Alpha Trading CIC
org.content: Hebrides Alpha Trading helps individuals with addiction problems by providing therapeutic employment opportunities via its services to the public. These include an islands recycling service, managing textile banks and upcycling materials into bespoke products such as Harris Tweed Clocks.

org.title: Home from Home (Scotland) Ltd
org.content: Home from Home, a furniture reuse organisation based in Dunbarton, takes donations of unwanted furniture, white goods and other household goods. These are then provided free of charge or at low cost to people in West Dunbartonshire who are on low incomes.

org.title: HomeAid West Lothian
org.content: HomeAid West Lothian is a charity based in Bathgate providing a free/low cost furniture service to homeless and low income families and individuals in need throughout West Lothian. All proceeds from the sale of furniture in our shop is used to support our service to families and individuals in need in West Lothian.

org.title: Instant Neighbour
org.content:
Instant Neighbour is a local charity based in Aberdeen.
For 35 years we have provided food parcels to those most in need, along with advice and support.
Our shops provide good quality reuse furniture, white goods, clothing and bric a brac, enabling those on low incomes to set up home.
Our Social Enterprises, Joinerinc, Carpetinc and Removalinc are professional services available to everyone.

org.title: Just Cycle
org.content: Just Cycle is a Borders charity that has been set up with the aim of recycling and reusing bikes that would otherwise have been thrown out. Unused bikes are recovered from a range of sources, transported to our base at Tweedbank Craft Centre and then recycled and made available to the local community at an affordable price.

org.title: Kinning Park Complex
org.content: Kinning Park Complex is an independent, multi use community space in the Southside of Glasgow. ? We provide a variety of great activities in a place that brings people together, helps reduce isolation, builds friendships and creates a real sense of community.

org.title: LAMH Recycle Limited
org.content: LAMH Recycle Ltd is a Motherwell-based social enterprise whose main objective is our ‘social inclusion agenda which we address through the provision of employability development opportunities within our supportive workplace environment. Our business activities focus on waste management, recycling and reuse.

org.title: Link Group Ltd
org.content: The LINK Group are a group of award-winning social enterprise companies serving more than 15,000 customers, making them one of the largest social landlords in Scotland.

org.title: Luma-IT
org.content: Luma-IT specialises in IT consultancy, management and improvement for charities, social enterprises, community groups and voluntary organisations. We are the only fully-fledged social enterprise IT company in the country, whose sole purpose is to provide high quality, reliable and cost-effective IT systems to our fellow third sector organisations.

org.title: Magpie
org.content: Magpie is a not-for-profit second-hand furniture shop that exists to promote a more sustainable way of living, providing the Aberdeenshire community with the chance to reuse, recycle, upcycle and find a unique bargain As well as being a shop, Magpie helps those in need by donating furniture and household goods through partner agencies and we work with our local foodbank and criminal justice department too.

org.title: Make Do and Grow CIC
org.content: We are a not-for-profit social enterprise in Glasgow, focused on supporting growing families with children aged 3-12, developing creativity and encouraging re-use and recycle. We encourage creative development through our structured classes and free play sessions, using predominantly recyclable materials and in our retail unit, we also offer affordable, quality pre-loved and upcycled clothing and toys.

org.title: Midlothian Advice & Resource Centre
org.content: Midlothian Advice and Resource Centre (MARC) is a community based social enterprise that collects unwanted furniture and white goods and provides them to families in the community on low income at a reduced or no cost.  MARC has a community shop in Dalkeith where refurbished furniture and electrical equipment can be purchased. As a social enterprise, MARC also provides employment and volunteer opportunities to people in the community.

org.title: Mixer CIC
org.content: Miixer CIC is a social enterprise based in East Lothian foccusing on reuse and keeping good things in local circulation, rather than landfill. From our shop in Dunbar we sell quality items cheaply to our local communities, donate to local groups and charities, and support those in need with free goods. Our clothing initiative Big Pick aims to eradicate clothing poverty in our area.

org.title: Moray Waste Busters
org.content: Moray Waste Busters runs a reuse hub in Forres next to the recycling centre where donations of furniture, household goods, bikes and garden items can also be made. We also promote awareness about reuse and recycling through an education programme for schools and other groups and provides volunteer placement opportunities.

org.title: Mull and Iona Community Trust
org.content: Mull & Iona Community Trust run the Mull & Iona Environmentally Sensitive Solutions (MESS) Project which delivers recycling services across the islands and two reuse furniture & charity shops.

org.title: Neilston Development Trust
org.content: Neilston Development Trust is a charity serving the residents of Neilston, helping them build on their strengths and create a sustainable future for their place. With a strong local membership, and an ambitious delivery programme, including a Bike Reuse Project we are committed to the physical, social and economic renewal and sustainability of Neilston.

org.title: Networks of Wellbeing
org.content: Networks of Wellbeing is a diverse charity that promotes and supports people in improving their mental health and wellbeing in Huntly. They run a Bike Shack Project a non-profit making bike recycling initiative.

org.title: New Start Highland
org.content: New Start Highlands mission is to tackle poverty, homelessness and long term unemployment in the Highlands. Our work creates social and environmental improvements within our local community through supporting people, delivering training opportunities and promoting re-use.

org.title: Open Gates
org.content: Open Gates will support prisoners and ex-prisoners through an employment and training programme with the aim of reducing re-offending and stopping the revolving door back into prison. Individuals who have managed to break the cycle will use their experience to mentor and support other offenders to do the same. Operating as a social enterprise, the organisation will manufacture, recycle, and upcycle furniture and white goods and sell to the general public.

org.title: Pretty Unique Boutique CIC
org.address: Badenheath Place, Cumbernauld, Glasgow G68 9HX, UK
org.content: Pretty Unique Boutique is a Community Interest Company (CIC) promoting arts and craft activities in the Chryston area and we have vintage, pre-loved and craft made items for sale to encourage recycling and reusing in our public shop.

org.title: PUSH
org.content: PUSH are Perth-based and provide supported employment experiences and further explore future options for their clients. Their aim is to enable people with additional support needs who are in the transition stage to be more informed about their working future. They run a recycling and reuse project, including two reuse retail units.

org.title: R:evolve Recycle
org.content: The R:evolve Recycle project aims to reduce textiles waste by delivering services which help people to think differently about their clothes.   We currently operate three swap shop boutiques in Cambuslang, Hamilton and Rutherglen as well as intergenerational childrens education programme, weekly ‘make-do-and-mend workshops for adults and a clothing bank for people living in poverty.

org.title: RAMH
org.content: RAMH is a charity in the mental health field providing information and services within a framework of recovery and support, which we see as essential to reinforce hope, respect and equality. The RAMH Reuse Superstore in Johnstone is a social enterprise, recycling and upcycling donated furniture, vintage, collectables and textiles. All profits go straight back into mental health services for local people.

org.title: ReBOOT
org.content: ReBOOT is a social enterprise, based in Forres that specialises in Computer and IT repair, reuse and recycling services. Any computer equipment that cannot be refurbished is disassembled, reduced to base components, then recycled in accordance with current SEPA regulations.

org.title: RECAP (N.Lanarkshire)
org.content: RECAP is a furniture and white good recycling project based in Cumbernauld. It collects, refurbishes and redistributes household goods within the local community, selling goods at low cost to the local community. RECAP also provides employment and volunteering opportunities in the communities it serves.

org.title: Recycle Mobility Centre
org.content: Recycle Mobility Centre offers a quality service that refurbishes, maintains, and repairs all types of mobility equipment to the highest standard and sells it used / second hand at an affordable price to those who can least afford to buy new equipment. We also offer volunteers a workplace opportunity and training that meets their specific needs including placing young people in mechanical engineering roles giving them their first chance to gain work experience and pursue a career in engineering and other maintenance vocations.

org.title: Recycling First Project
org.content: Recycling First assist individual families throughout East Lothian who are in receipt of benefits to access necessary household furniture and collect good quality second hand furniture to distribute to disadvantaged families.

org.title: Recyke-a-Bike
org.content: Recyke-a-bike is a Stirling social enterprise that delivers bike recycling, reuse, training services and outreach work as well as a community café. Our aims are to help people, our local community and environment by: Supporting people into employment, education, training and volunteering: Helping more people to choose cycling for low carbon transport: Improving better health and wellbeing: Stopping bikes ending up in landfill: and of course for fun.

org.title: Repair Café Glasgow
org.content: Repair Cafe Glasgow is a voluntary organisation, founded in 2017 on the principles of Repair Café International, and built upon the idea that our possessions have lots of life left in them when we maintain and repair them. Doing this together with others builds social cohesion and combats isolation, while helping reduce the size of our landfills.

org.title: Scottish Borders Social Enterprise Chamber
org.content: The Scottish Borders Social Enterprise Chamber provides a collective voice and focal point for the development of social enterprise in the Scottish Borders, offering a variety of services to help our members develop and grow.

org.title: SeAscape
org.content: The name Seascape (South Ayrshire Escape from Homelessness) is synonymous with the relief of poverty and homelessness in South Ayrshire. Established in 1999 we began delivering support to the homeless community and those at risk of homelessness through our Rent Deposit Guarantee System and since that time has helped thousands of people with housing and poverty issues. Since 2012, Seascape has also been providing housing support services on behalf of South Ayrshire Council.

org.title: SHAX
org.content: SHAX is a Charity serving the Dumfries area, receiving donations of household goods, furniture, white goods, electrical items, linen and clothing which are reused to supply minimal cost crisis need used furniture and white goods to people in Dumfries and the surrounding areas. The SHAX charity furniture warehouse is also open to the public.

org.title: Somebody Cares SCIO
org.content: Somebody Cares is the leading organisation in Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire providing free food, furniture, clothing and much more to the poor, the vulnerable and the marginalised people of the area.

org.title: Something Old Something New
org.content: Something Old Something New (SOSN) is a furniture reuse project based in Stirling. It manages a retail outlet for upcycled and second hand goods in order to raise funds for Parkinsons Disease research.

org.title: SoulRiders Scotland
org.content: Soulriders vision is to create a stronger, healthier, more active community through cycling. As a true community-led organisation our people come from all walks of life and from our Cycling Centre in the south-side of Glasgow we refurbish donated bikes that can then be given back to the community, carry out repairs on both members and the public bikes and offer mechanical training.

org.title: Starter Packs Glasgow - Magpie's Eye Reuse Store
org.content: Starter Packs Glasgow is a charity based in Govan working to alleviate poverty across the city. By providing packs of essential household goods to those moving into a new tenancy, often after homelessness, we can make houses more homely, and help people to sustain their tenancy. We do this through the help and support of our local community, much-needed donations and the many staff and volunteers were lucky to work with.

org.title: Stella's Voice
org.content: Stella's Voice are a UK charity that believe every item, no matter how small, helps to change a life. We manage a number of UK furniture reuse and charity shops, including one in Peterhead, Aberdeenshire.

org.title: Stranraer Furniture Project Ltd
org.content: The Community Reuse Shop (Stranraer) is intended to provide a service to the public, so they can donate and reuse a whole range of household items. It is also for people to volunteer so they can learn new skills and share skills. This is for people who have been long term unemployed, so they can gain skills and make personal progress, to increase their prospects in gaining employment.

org.title: Sustaining Dunbar
org.content: Since 2008 Sustaining Dunbar has been bringing people together to support new initiatives which aim to make Dunbar and District a better place to live and a more resilient community -making it easier to work locally, cut energy consumption, grow more food locally, safer and easier to walk and cycle and to improve public transport.

org.title: The Furniture Lodge
org.content: The Furniture Lodge in Stonehaven encourages people to recycle and reuse, rather than discarding items that could be of benefit to others. Moreover, as well as raising funds by restoring and selling household items, clothing, and electrical goods, we also provide training and employment opportunities for youths and adults.

org.title: The Piano Project
org.content: The Piano Project is a Glasgow-based social enterprise aiming to reduce social isolation & increase opportunities for people to connect by embedding greater permission to play into the fabric of the city by redistributing piano donations back into the community and facilitating a new appreciation of acoustic pianos in Glasgow & beyond.

org.title: Transform Community Development
org.content: Transform Community Development Dundee's aim as an organisation is to meet the needs of vulnerable people by listening to what they say and work with them to find individual solutions to the needs they identify. To achieve this we continue to provide a range of services that we hope really do make a difference. including a furniture reuse service, a fareshare food service and a catering service.

org.title: Trust In Fife
org.content: Trust in Fife is a homelessness support charity involved in managing temporary accommodation hostels and a tenancy share programme. We manage two reuse charity shops to help us raise income to deliver our services across Fife.

org.title: Upkeep
org.content: Upkeep, or to give it's full name - Shettleston Community Enterprises is a social enterprise in Glasgow set up by Shettleston Housing Association to deliver property maintenance and estate caretaking services whilst offering jobs and training to local people. They run a small furniture reuse service.

org.title: Strathcarron Hospice Falkirk Reuse Furniture Store
org.address: 2 Main Street, Bainsford, Falkirk FK2 7PB, UK
org.content:
Strathcarron Hospice retail sell on customer donations of clothing, furniture, sports equipment, and general bric a brac via our retail shops across Central Scotland and Forth Valley. We deliver and collect furniture items. Anything we can't sell is recycled. 

The Falkirk Furniture Shop is located near our Retail Distribution Centre and is an ideal place to find preloved furniture looking for a new home. From dining tables to three piece suites there is something for every room in your house. With upcycling as popular as ever, why not make a visit and see what you could find?

org.title: Inverurie Men's Shed
org.content: Inverurie and District Men's Shed is a registered charity and is run by the members. The Shed provides not just an escape but a place to meet other men, enjoy social company and either pass on their own skills or learn new ones.

org.title: Starter Packs Glasgow - Magpie's Nest Reuse Store
org.content: Starter Packs Glasgow is a charity based in Govan working to alleviate poverty across the city. By providing packs of essential household goods to those moving into a new tenancy, often after homelessness, we can make houses more homely, and help people to sustain their tenancy. We do this through the help and support of our local community, much-needed donations and the many staff and volunteers were lucky to work with.

org.title: Employability Orkney
org.content: Employability Orkney run a furniture reuse shop in Kirkwall. They accept donations of good-quality furniture, household goods, white goods and clothing. They perform Portable Appliance Testing (PAT) on electrical goods to allow resale. Their showroom sells furniture, household items, white goods and clothing at affordable prices to the Orkney public.

org.title: Redeem Exchange
org.content: Redeem Exchange is part of Trade Right International CiC.  We offer an innovative, cost-saving and environmentally friendly solution for empty plastic hand sanitiser and soap product bottles and containers.  Our main objective is to divert plastic waste going to landfill through a simple collect, wash, refill, and return service.   Based in Greenock, our aim is to provide employability training and experience in a safe learning environment for individuals in recovery, with an offending background or who are long term unemployed.  We strive to make a difference by caring for planet, people, pounds, and place in all we do.

org.title: Bike for Good Glasgow South
org.content:
Bike for Good are based in Glasgow.

Our Vision is an environment where everyone benefits from riding a bicycle, and our Mission is to enable people in Scotland to cycle as their mode of transport.

We refurbish, repair and teach communities how to maintain a bicycles, improve the environment, teach skills, and improve mental and physical health.

org.title: Empower Women for Change
org.address: Saint Enoch Square, Glasgow G1 4DF, UK
org.content: Empower Women for Change (EWfC) was formed in 2015 in response to the growing needs of the diverse women in Scotland where gaps in support were identified in relation to the empowerment and advancement of women’s rights and active participation in all aspects of civil, economic and political settings.

org.title: All Together Edinburgh
org.content: All Together Edinburgh is a social enterprise with charitable status. It was set up in 2010 after recognising that there were very few training opportunities for people with learning disabilities to learn skills that would help them work within the retail/charity retailing sector or customer facing environment.

org.title: Budding Engineers CIC
org.content: We offer services to schools, groups and individuals around technology, design and circular economy. We are looking to encourage and inspire STEAM into children by Introducing them to the world of 3D Design and Digital Technology using Computer Aided Design.

org.title: Community Gift Exchange
org.content: The Community Gift Exchange SCIO is a registered Scottish Charity helping to generate flourishing communities in Ayrshire. The CGX Restoration Shop in Ayr is not only a showroom of second hand goods it also has a backroom Repair and Restore Centre.

org.title: Moray Reach Out
org.content: Moray Reach Out is a charity that has several social enterprises around the Moray that gives training and work experience to vulnerable adults: Moray Reach Out runs three businesses including Waste Watchers, Buckie Yarns and In Stitches. Each business provides training and work experience for vulnerable adults in the Moray area.

org.title: Grassmarket Community Project
org.content: Grassmarket Furniture (formerly GRoW) started in 2006 and is one of the social enterprises in the Grassmarket Community Project. The workshop is open across four days per week and has about six regular volunteers on each day. They transform unwanted church pews and other wood into beautiful, bespoke pieces of furniture and home furnishings.

org.title: Sustainable Kirriemuir
org.content: Sustainable Kirriemuir formed in 2019 when a community of people decided to try and live well without costing the Earth.

org.title: The Bike Station Perth
org.content: The Bike Station Perth's aim is to help people start and keep cycling and that begins with the bicycle. Their shop stocks everything you'll need to keep your bike in perfect condition. With the emphasis on old parts reclaimed from donated bikes, there is no cheaper way of looking after your bike whilst keeping waste out of landfill.

org.title: Home-Start Clackmannanshire
org.address: Alloa Business Centre, Whins Road, Alloa, UK
org.content: Home-Start Clackmannanshire have been supporting families through-out local communities across Clackmannanshire since 1988. We manage a charity shop and starter pack project.

org.title: Nest Creative Spaces CIC
org.content:
Nest Creative Spaces is a Community Interest Company and non-profit Social Enterprise by
volunteers. We have a craft remnant shop that receives donations of part used arts & crafts materials that we resell thus keeping them out of landfill. Our new project, Thrift n Thrive aims to encourage and support reuse of these materials by creating imagination kits for your up-cyclers to purchase and craft kits for use in a series of reuse and recycling workshops and for sale.

org.title: Glasgow Tool Library
org.content: The Glasgow Tool Library (GTL) works just like a normal library, but instead of sharing books, we share tools. Established in 2017, the tool library is a community-led social enterprise and collective that promotes sharing, collaboration, and learning as forms of resistance, empowerment, and resilience.

org.title: Music Broth
org.content: Music Broth is a Glasgow-based social enterprise that has established a musical instrument and equipment sharing library. The wider vision is to build a connected music community throughout Glasgow and beyond based on the sharing of instruments and experiences.

org.title: Fed Up Community Cafe
org.content: The Fed Up Community Café in Stranraer helps to tackle poverty and social isolation by creating a safe café space to bring people together and offer help & advice. This includes looking at food waste and food poverty issues.
